definition: confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.english: I took a swing at him and knocked him silly.
sentences.chinese: 我挥拳打了他一下，把他打得晕头转向。

sentences.english: He was so balled up that he did not know if he was coming or going.
sentences.chinese: 他被搞得晕头转向，以致不知道是来还是去。

sentences.english: The boy fell head over heels in love with Shary .
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩与莎莉沉溺情海，爱得晕头转向。

sentences.english: He is head over-heels in love with her.
sentences.chinese: 他与她沉溺情海，爱得晕头转向。

sentences.english: We used outflanking tactics and the enemies were confused and disoriented.
sentences.chinese: 我们采用迂回战术，把敌人弄得晕头转向。

sentences.english: He became confused and agitated, waving his gun at us.
sentences.chinese: 他有些晕头转向，激动地对着我们挥舞他的枪。

definition: to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
variant of 頭暈腦脹|头晕脑胀[tou2 yun1 nao3 zhang4]
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
to go round and round/running around in circles/fig. frantically busy
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
